author: Thomas odum
text:
Vestiairecollective.com won't back my shoes. They won't get back to me or give me any indication of where my shoes are. 

I sent my shoes in. A pair of gucci tennis 1977 high top black. I purchased them in Miami and I couldn't take the box me on thr flight so I ditched it and packed my shoes. Fast forward to the sell of the shoes on Vestiairecollective.com. 

Now I put the shoes in a replacement box because I threw away the original box to back them in my luggage. The shoes were packed in a authentic gucci box from another pair of gucci shoes. The item was sent directly to the buyer. Buyer raised questions of authenticity because it wasn't the original box. 

Vestiairecollective.com was sent the shoes and hasn't returned them at all and won't give me explanation to why they won't. Customer service says they are sitting in a warehouse. Why???? I've chatted with 6 different customer service representatives and they all say they email me. I complained everyday to them with no results. I'm considering filing a law suit against Vestiairecollective.com for theft. Vestiairecollective.com has had more enough time to send my item back give me a reason to why it's being held. 

Vestiairecollective.com gives the buyer 72 hours to file a complaint which in my opinion is to long. Buyer could wear them, send them back, with a full refund and now the seller is stuck with a used shoe and get penalized. Not fair. 

Hopefully Vestiairecollective.com see this and finally want to do their damn jobs. I don't recommend people sell on this site. author: Lainne Vega
text: I should have known the moment I discovered they discretely charge a higher exchange rate that this company was dishonest. After chatting with a seller who said she sent me an offer, the offer was the listing price. As we discussed more, I learned she was offering me 1750 euros which should be $1880 but in my end it was showing up $2035. No one in customer service could help me. They wash their hands and say a third party handles the billing. I realized you can change your settings to another currency. When I changed to Euros, there it was, listed at 1750 euros. I have a MasterCard with zero foreign transaction fees so I purchased it in Euros. I got an email confirming my purchase. When I tell the seller I’m so excited for the item, she tells me she hasn’t received a shipping label. Customer support said they were verifying payment and if they needed supporting documents, they would email me. The account is in my name. Everything matches so I didn’t worry. 4 days go by and still nothing. Customer support keeps telling me they’ll email me after forwarding to their “experts” but nothing. On the 5th morning, the seller emails me saying her item is showing back on sale. When I look at my order status it says “cancelled by seller.” Seller says it wasn’t her. Customer support says they can’t verify my payment and have cancelled. Seems like they want to pocket the extra money from the exchange rate and since I found a way around it, they decided to cancel my order and blame the seller. Again, was told I’d get an email. They still haven’t refunded my money or communicated what they couldn’t “verify” if the account is valid and mine!
title: Pocketing higher exchange rates

author: Allison Brody
text: Do not use Vestiaire, they will steal your money.  I live in the UK and recently sold three items on their website to three buyers in the UK.  My total sales were 212.14 pounds and taking into account their selling fee (12%) and processing fee (3%), I should have received 174.57 pounds.  However, when they paid me, I received 134.44 pounds.  I emailed them to ask them about the missing 40 pounds they owed me and they said it was because of currency conversion fees.  That makes no sense to me as I was selling it within the UK.  It is very un-transparent, as they did not tell me what currency these people whose addresses were in the UK decided to purchase my items with and even so - there should be a disclaimer about conversion fees that are almost 20% of the total sale price!  I think they are not being honest and are using that as an excuse to skim money off of customers.   As there are many more resale platforms around now, I will no longer be using Vestiaire.
title: Do not use Vestiaire - they steal your money

author: Nancy Sterg
text:
I have used Vestiaire on a couple occasions purchasing items below £500 for which I may have waited a while to receive,but I would say had an overall good experience.
I purchased a lovely bag from an Italian seller for £1200 over a month ago.Vestiaire provided a tracking number which only worked , up until Italy.I am based in the UK and had absolutely no visibility of where my item was 3 weeks from when seller sent and even though I reached out to Vestiaire to ask for an update they just said it may take another week.
A week later the Vestiaire app updated to ‘item delivered’ and of course it had not been delivered!I am still trying to get any update from Vestiaire claiming they are investigating the courier they said delivered it,but they can’t provide me with any proof whatsoever.They keep sending me ‘we have not forgotten you’ emails with no update either.
Thank God I paid with PayPal,and I was able to request my money back through them..
Their after sales care/customer service is shocking and non existent sadly.I went to Gucci directly and purchased the bag,Vestiaire never delivered to me..
title: OK for low value items,but unreliable for higher value ones
